matched.expectedTitle: Style Tag XSS in xss23 Endpoint
matched.actualTitle: Style Tag XSS in xss23 Endpoint
matched.matchReason: Perfect match - both findings describe the same vulnerability: a cross-site scripting vulnerability in the xss23 endpoint caused by a regex blacklist filter with pattern <(?!style\b)[^>]+> that explicitly allows <style> tags through while blocking other HTML tags. Both identify HIGH severity and the same attack vector using malicious <style> tags containing JavaScript payloads. The POC execution confirmed the vulnerability through multiple injection vectors including CSS expressions and JavaScript URLs within style tags.

extra.title: Missing Critical Security Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - This finding identifies missing security headers (CSP, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, HSTS, Referrer-Policy, Permissions-Policy, Cache-Control) that were not part of the expected findings list. This represents a valid security vulnerability related to insecure design and security misconfiguration that creates multiple attack vectors including clickjacking, MIME sniffing, and content injection.

extra.title: Server Information Disclosure via HTTP Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - This finding identifies version information disclosure in the Server header revealing Werkzeug 1.0.1 and Python 3.13.3, which was not part of the expected findings list. While LOW severity, it represents a valid information disclosure vulnerability that increases attack surface by allowing reconnaissance and targeting of known vulnerabilities.

extra.title: Missing Cache-Control Headers - Sensitive Data Caching Risk
extra.assessment: New discovery - This finding identifies the absence of Cache-Control, Pragma, and Expires headers allowing sensitive HTTP responses to be cached by browsers and proxies, which was not part of the expected findings list. This represents a valid privacy and security risk for applications handling authentication and personal data, categorized as security misconfiguration.
